p: Some studies propose a rational view to undertaking a complementary prime-boost immunization regimen, when a DNA vaccine is used in the immunization schedule. Usually, a DNA vaccine is employed for priming while recombinant proteins or peptides, inactivated vaccines, or viral vectors are used for boosting the immune response ( 4). On the other hand, viral vectors are normally used during the first immunization (prime) and the immune response could be boosted with recombinant proteins ( 4). Moreover, the immunogenicity of this immunization regimen can be improved including other factors that enhance the effect of vaccines such as cytokines ( 44) and other presentation forms, for example, nanoparticles, or microparticles-based formulations or VLP.
